jProtocol.Abstract.View.keyvaluetree

Class KeyValueTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • jProtocol.Abstract.View.keyvaluetree.KeyValueTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.TreeSelectionListener

    public class KeyValueTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.TreeSelectionListener
    A KeyValueTree can display lists of KeyValueObjects with children and has the ability to highlight changed objects after an update.
    Author:
    Tom Petersen, 2015

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KeyValueTree(java.lang.String title, HtmlInfoUpdater htmlInfoUpdater, boolean highlightChangedFields)
      Creates a key value tree.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void expandAll()
      Expands all key value objects with children.

      Returns the tree view with an enclosing JScrollPane.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyValueTree

        public KeyValueTree(java.lang.String title,
                    HtmlInfoUpdater htmlInfoUpdater,
                    boolean highlightChangedFields)
        Creates a key value tree. If highlightChangedFields is true, then key value objects with changed values will be highlighted when the tree is updated.
        Parameters:
        title - the title used for the tree root
        htmlInfoUpdater - a info updater to set the content of the info view
        highlightChangedFields - true, if changed fields should be highlighted during tree update

    • Method Detail

      • valueChanged

        public void valueChanged(javax.swing.event.TreeSelectionEvent e)
        Specified by:
        valueChanged in interface javax.swing.event.TreeSelectionListener

      • updateKeyValueObjectList

        public void updateKeyValueObjectList(java.util.List<KeyValueObject> kvoList)
        Updates the trees key value objects. If higlightChangedFields is true, the changed objects will be highlighted. Expanded key value objects will stay expanded.
        Parameters:
        kvoList - the new key value object list

      • getView

        public javax.swing.JComponent getView()
        Returns the tree view with an enclosing JScrollPane.
        Returns:
        the tree view

      • expandAll

        public void expandAll()
        Expands all key value objects with children.
